sen.j: 裲襠（りょうとう）とは、武官の礼服 (宮中)に用いられる儀仗の鎧。
sen.e: "Ryoto" is an armor of honor worn by military officers as their formal attire (at court).

sen.j: 掛け鎧と呼ばれる古代中国の鎧を模したものである。
sen.e: Ryoto is an imitation of ancient Chinese armor called "kake-yoroi" (a kind of ancient armor made of metal or leather slats spliced each other by strings.)

sen.j: 肩口に房があるものと金襴で飾ってあるものの二種が有るが、基本的には役柄などによっての大きな差異は無い。
sen.e: There are two kinds of ryoto, one with tassels on pauldrons and another decorated with gold brocade, but basically there is little difference between the two in their uses depending on characters of the wearers.

sen.j: 精緻に刺繍を施した厚地の絹を、膝上までを覆う丈の袖が無く脇のあいた貫頭衣の形に仕立てられている。
sen.e: It is made of heavyweight silk cloth trimmed with exquisite embroidery, tailored in the shape of kantoi (a simple type of clothing consisting of a large piece of cloth with a hole in the middle for the head) without sleeves, with open sides, and covering down to the knees.

sen.e: Ryoto is worn over ho (a round necked robe worn by nobility) and girded by a sash.

sen.j: 武人や龍神などを演じる際に身に着けるもので、蘭陵王 (雅楽)、納曽利などの演目で着用する。
sen.e: Ryoto is attired by players of gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) when they perform bujin (warrior) and ryujin (dragon god) in such programs as Ranryo-o, Nasori and so on.
